addressleaf.section: A Monsier Monsier de Sidney Chevalier, et Gouverneur de la Ville de Vlissinges

r
Thomas Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
I have perused those Articles, w
ch
yo
r
L.
sent unto me, and I have shortly sette
downe, what I thinke of every point.
There is very great reason in
e most
of them: but because
e chiefest can not
well be perfour med, w
t
out some further
order from her
Ma
tie
yo
w
shall finde it a
great ease, to delay
their
yo
r
answear till my
L. of Buckhursts
coming hither, and then
to put them in good hope, of some speedy
redresse, to their full contentment. This
course is
e best
at I can thinke uppon:
w
ch
yet yo
r
L
ordship
will use w
t
better dexteritie
than I can expresse.
whereuppon I com-
mend it, and all yo
r
other actions to Gods
good direction. From
e Hage
May
28
29
15
90

r
L
ordships
at commaundem
t
Tho. Bodley.
Uppon closing up of this letter, I receaved
yo
r
L
ordships
of
e 25 and have dealt w
t
e
Councel
in yo
r
behalf. Howbeit they will take no answear
to have yo
r
L. altogether excused, unles they may
have, at
e lest
one
company.
